mantra: May the grace of Lord Parashurama be upon everyone.

home.highlight: A sacred tapobhumi - the confluence of devotion, peace and divinity.
aboutTeaser: Sanyasikatte Sri Parashurama Temple is a serene kshetra in the Western Ghats, dedicated to Lord Parashurama, the sixth avatar of Sri Mahavishnu.
With more than a century of heritage, the temple brings together devotion, community service and the warmth of village life.

hero.title: Welcome to the sacred temple in the Western Ghats
hero.subtitle: Lord Parashurama, the sixth incarnation of Vishnu, is the presiding deity here. This sacred abode, blending ancient tradition with renewal, offers devotees peace of mind and strength in life.

about.subtitle: A sacred tapobhumi growing through decades of devotion
highlights: Heritage & Origin: Established in 1915 by members of the Phadke family at Sanyasikatte, Mundaje in the Western Ghats.
Sacred Tapobhumi: Revered as a serene seat of austerity where devotion, service and village life blend harmoniously.
Public Temple: Formally offered to the public in 1977 and since then managed as a community temple open to all devotees.
focusPoints: Main Deity: Sri Parashurama, the sixth incarnation of Sri Mahavishnu, worshipped here as the protector of dharma.
Parivara Devatas: Sanyasi Purusha / Kshetrapala, Sri Siddhivinayaka, Sri Annapoorneshwari, the Navagrahas, Naga Devata and the Daivas.
Daily Worship: Traditional puja, naivedya and alankara are performed every day as per the agama and local customs.
devoteesPoints: Renovation & Architecture: Reconstructed in 2018 in traditional stone architecture with the wholehearted support of devotees.
Regular Observances: Deepotsava, Pratishta anniversary, Udayasthamana Bhajane, Ugadi, Satyanarayana Puja on every Sankramana, and monthly Sankashta Hara Ganapati Puja.
Prayers & Blessings: Devotees seek removal of obstacles, family well-being, peace of mind, prosperity and the fulfillment of righteous wishes.

deities.title: Deities
deities.subtitle: Blessings of Lord Parashurama with the Parivara Devatas

items.name: Sri Parashurama
items.note: Presiding deity - the establisher of dharma.
items.description: Sri Parashurama, the sixth incarnation of Lord Vishnu, is worshipped here as the protector of dharma and the tapasvi who restored the coastal region. Devotees seek his refuge for righteous decision-making in family life, protection from injustice, courage, and spiritual strength.

items.name: Sri Siddhivinayaka
items.note: Remover of obstacles.
items.description: Sri Siddhivinayaka is the giver of auspicious beginnings and the remover of all hindrances. Before embarking on important endeavors - education, career, travel, business, home-related rituals or marriages - devotees pray here for clarity, firm resolve, success, and peace of mind.

items.name: Sri Annapoorneshwari
items.note: Goddess of nourishment.
items.description: Sri Annapoorneshwari, the divine mother of nourishment, grants abundance and fulfillment. Devotees pray that their homes and the temple remain free from scarcity, and that everyone experiences prosperity, satisfaction, and the joy of shared meals. Prayers are also offered for strength to support annaprasada and charitable feeding.

items.name: Naga Devaru
items.note: Family prosperity and remedy for Nagadosha.
items.description: Naga Devaru is revered as the guardian of land, lineage, fertility and ancestral continuity. Worship of the serpent deities is believed to bring children, good health, wealth, and the overall growth of the family. For strengthening ancestral blessings and remedying Nagadosha, devotees perform Naga Pratishthe, Ashlesha Bali, Siyala Abhisheka, Naga Tambila, Sarpa Samskara and Naga Homa.

items.name: Navagrahas
items.note: A rare facility available for devotees in Dakshina Kannada.
items.description: The Navagrahas represent the nine planetary principles believed to influence various aspects of life. Having a Navagraha shrine in this region is considered a special blessing. Worship here is offered for relief from graha doshas, improved health and wealth, advancement in career and business, and for mental peace and balance.

items.name: Kshetrapala / Sanyasi Purusha
items.note: Guardian Deity.
items.description: Kshetrapala, worshipped here as Sanyasi Purusha, is revered as the guardian of the kshetra - its boundaries, traditions, and devotees. Connected to the ancient tapas-heritage of Sanyasikatte, this deity protects the temple, removes fears and subtle obstacles, and grants peace, safety, and spiritual purity to the surroundings.

timings.title: Puja & Darshan Timings
timings.subtitle: Daily schedule
specials: Every Sankranti 7:00 PM - Public Satyanarayana Puja
Every Sankashti 7:00 PM - Special Puja, Annaprasada

festivals.title: Festivals & Special Observances
festivals.subtitle: Annual and monthly pujas at the kshetra

items.name: Chandramana Ugadi
items.note: Panchanga shravana and prasada distribution in the evening at 4:30 PM.

items.name: Vaishakha Shudda |3
items.note: Kalabhivardhini parayana for auspicious growth and well-being.

items.name: Vaishakha Shudda |4
items.note: Pratishta anniversary of Sri Parashurama and all parivara devatas; homa, offering of fruits, and traditional areca-nut seva.

items.name: Ashadha Shudda |11
items.note: Bhajans from sunrise to sunset in devotion to Sri Parashurama and the deities.

items.name: Shravana Shudda Full Moon
items.note: Rigveda and Yajurveda Upakarma performed as per tradition.

items.name: Every Sankramana
items.note: Public Sri Satyanarayana Puja at 7:00 PM; seva contribution ₹1,500.

items.name: Every Sankashta Hara Chaturthi
items.note: At the sannidhi of Sri Siddhivinayaka: Atharvashirsha chanting, abhisheka, puja, panchakajjaya, annaprasada and rangapuja; santarpana contribution ₹6,000.

items.name: Dhanur Masa
items.note: Special Dhanu Puja to Sri Parashurama in the early morning at 6:30 AM.

items.name: Navaratri
items.note: Special flower puja and kumkumarchana every evening at 7:00 PM in the sannidhi of Sri Annapoorneshwari.

items.name: Akshaya Tritiya
items.note: Sri Parashurama Jayanti observed with special programs and worship.

items.name: Kartika Bahula Panchami
items.note: Annual Deepotsava of Sri Parashurama with rows of lamps lit around the temple.

items.name: Deity Alankara
items.note: Sanctum & mantapa

items.name: Festivals
items.note: Brahmakalashotsava / Deepotsava / Navaratri

items.name: Village & Greens
items.note: Evening Deeparadhane
